definitions.definition: Especially of a liquid, to become solid due to low temperature.
To lower something's temperature to the point that it freezes or becomes hard.
To drop to a temperature below zero degrees celsius, where water turns to ice.
definitions.example: It didn't freeze this winter, but last winter was very harsh.

definitions.definition: To be affected by extreme cold.
definitions.example: Don't go outside wearing just a t-shirt; you'll freeze!

definitions.definition: (of machines and software) To come to a sudden halt, stop working (functioning).
definitions.example: Since the last update, the program freezes / freezes up after a few minutes of use.

definitions.definition: (of people and other animals) To stop (become motionless) or be stopped due to attentiveness, fear, surprise, etc.
definitions.example: Despite all of the rehearsals, I froze up as soon as I got on stage.

definitions.definition: To cause someone to become motionless.
To lose or cause to lose warmth of feeling; to shut out; to ostracize.
definitions.example: Over time, he froze towards her, and ceased to react to her friendly advances.

definitions.definition: To cause loss of animation or life in, from lack of heat; to give the sensation of cold to; to chill.
To prevent the movement or liquidation of a person's financial assets
definitions.example: The court froze the criminal's bank account.

definitions.definition: Of prices, spending etc., to keep at the same level, without any increase.
Having undergone the process of freezing; in ice form.
definitions.example: The mammoth has been frozen for ten thousand years.
I just stood frozen as the robber pointed at me with his gun.

definitions.definition: (of a bank account or assets) In a state such that transactions are not allowed.
